So you're trying to make the folders under /etc/apache2/sites-available/ symlink to folders in your home directory?
If I'm understanding it properly, you have those links backwards.
/etc/apache2/sites-available/VHOST should be a symlink to the VHOST in your home directory.
You are not understanding what a symlink is.
the script creates the VHOST in teh home folder -- i want to link it to the /etc/apache2/sites-available folder
A symlink does not copy or move anything around.
It's like a shortcut in Windows.
What you want to happen is that when you run that Apache setup utility, it will look in the /etc/.../sites-available/VHOST and will FOLLOW the symlink back to your home directory.
Those are not real filenames, obviously.
